{
  "Q1": "What is the purpose of the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A1": "The ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022 provides guidance and recommendations for various aspects of agriculture, including fisheries, poultry, and crop management, to help farmers improve their productivity and sustainability."

  "Q2": "What are some of the key recommendations for fisheries management in the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A2": "The advisory suggests regular water quality testing, proper feed management, and maintaining optimal stocking density for fish farming."

  "Q3": "What is the importance of soil health in agriculture according to the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A3": "Soil health is crucial for providing essential nutrients to crops, ensuring their growth and productivity, and maintaining the overall health of the agricultural ecosystem."

  "Q4": "What are some of the measures suggested for pest and disease management in the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A4": "The advisory recommends integrated pest management strategies, use of biopesticides, and proper sanitation practices to prevent and control pests and diseases in crops."

  "Q5": "How does the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022 suggest managing water resources for agriculture?",
  "A5": "The advisory emphasizes the importance of water conservation, efficient irrigation techniques, and rainwater harvesting to ensure adequate water supply for agricultural activities."

  "Q6": "What are some of the recommendations for sustainable farming practices in the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A6": "The advisory suggests the use of organic farming methods, crop rotation, and intercropping to promote soil health, reduce chemical inputs, and increase biodiversity in agricultural systems."

  "Q7": "What is the role of ICAR in providing agro-advisory services to farmers?",
  "A7": "ICAR, as a premier agricultural research organization in India, provides scientific and technical guidance to farmers through its agro-advisory services, helping them adopt best practices and improve their productivity."

  "Q8": "How does the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022 address climate change and its impact on agriculture?",
  "A8": "The advisory highlights the need for climate-smart agricultural practices, such as the use of drought-resistant crop varieties, conservation agriculture, and agroforestry, to mitigate the effects of climate change on agriculture."

  "Q9": "What are some of the key recommendations for managing livestock and poultry farming in the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022?",
  "A9": "The advisory suggests proper feed management, vaccination, and disease control measures, along with maintaining hygienic conditions, to ensure the health and productivity of livestock and poultry."

  "Q10": "How can farmers access the ICAR agro-advisory for KHARIF 2022 and other relevant information?",
  "A10": "Farmers can access the advisory through various channels, such as the ICAR website, mobile apps, and extension services, as well as through workshops and training programs organized by ICAR and its partner organizations."
}

  "Q1": "What is the aim of HarvestPlus and ICRISAT's work on pearl millet biofortification?",
  "A1": "To reduce micronutrient deficiency among people consuming pearl millet as a staple food."
  
  "Q2": "What is the name of the improved pearl millet variety developed by HarvestPlus and ICRISAT?",
  "A2": "ICTP 8203 Fe-10-2, also known as 'Dhanshakti'."
  
  "Q3": "In which year was 'Dhanshakti' first released in Maharashtra?",
  "A3": "2012"
  
  "Q4": "What percentage of the recommended daily allowance (RDA) of iron can be met by consuming 200g of 'Dhanshakti' for adult men and children in India?",
  "A4": "100%"
  
  "Q5": "What percentage of the RDA of iron can be met by consuming 200g of 'Dhanshakti' for non-pregnant and non-lactating women in India?",
  "A5": "60%"
  
  "Q6": "What is the purpose of ICAR's Consortia Research Table 1?",
  "A6": "To accelerate the development of biofortified varieties and enhance the nutritional value of commonly consumed staples."
  
  "Q7: How does the nutritional composition of pearl millet compare to other cereals?",
  "A7": "Pearl millet has a lower carbohydrate content, higher protein and fat content, and higher iron content compared to other cereals."
  
  "Q8: What is the name of the platform on Biofortification addressing rice, wheat, maize, sorghum, pearl millet, and small millets?",
  "A8": "CRP (Consortia Research Platform) on Biofortification."
  
  "Q9: How many biofortified varieties of rice, wheat, maize, and pearl millet have been developed through the Biofortification Programme?",
  "A9": "17"
  
  "Q10: What is the name of the organization working on the development of biofortified pearl millet cultivars?",
  "A10": "All India Coordinated Research Project on Pearl Millet (AICRP-Pearl Millet)"
}

{
  "Q1": "What happens to the income from investments of earmarked funds?",
  "A1": "The income from investments of earmarked funds is added to the respective funds."
  
  "Q2": "How are government grants for capital expenditure treated?",
  "A2": "Government grants for capital expenditure are treated as of Capital Fund."
  
  "Q3": "When are government grants for revenue expenditure treated as income?",
  "A3": "Government grants for revenue expenditure are treated as income of the year in which they are realized."
  
  "Q4": "What happens to unutilized government grants?",
  "A4": "Unutilized government grants are treated as funds to be carried forward and refunded, as per government directions."
  
  "Q5": "How are drawals from the AP Cess fund utilized?",
  "A5": "Drawals from the AP Cess fund are utilized against approved schemes, and receipts against this grant are treated as income in the Income and Expenditure Account."
  
  "Q6": "What happens to unutilized grants from the AP Cess fund?",
  "A6": "Unutilized grants from the AP Cess fund are carried forward as a Liability and for utilization in the subsequent years."
  
  "Q7": "What are revolving fund loans used for?",
  "A7": "Revolving fund loans are granted to ICAR institutes, State Agricultural Universities, and NGOs to enable them to undertake income-generating schemes."
  
  "Q8": "How are revolving fund loans exhibited in the accounts?",
  "A8": "Revolving fund loans are exhibited under Current Assets Loans & Advances until their repayment in instalments."
  
  "Q9": "What happens to the repayment of advances by institutes, SAUs, and NGOs?",
  "A9": "The repayment of advances in instalments by institutes, SAUs, and NGOs is monitored through the Headquarter."
  
  "Q10": "How are advances given to ICAR institutes treated during consolidation of accounts for ICAR as a whole?",
  "A10": "The advances given to ICAR institutes are set off during consolidation of accounts for ICAR as a whole."
}

  "A2": "Millets are a group of small-grained cereals that are widely cultivated and consumed in arid and semi-arid parts of the world."
  
  "Q3": "What are some of the agronomic benefits of millets?",

  "A4": "Millets contain about 60–68% carbohydrates, 6–12% protein, 1.7–5.4% fat, and 1.3–2.7% total ash content. They are also good sources of dietary fiber, minerals, B-vitamins, and phytochemicals."

  "A6: Sorghum and pearl millet are the major millets, while finger millet, foxtail millet, little millet, proso millet, kodo millet, and barnyard millet are the important small millets."
  
  "Q7: What are the key benefits of millets in terms of climate resilience?",
  "A7: Millets can survive under changing climate scenarios, making them vital for achieving global nutritional security in a sustainable manner."
  
  "Q8: How do millets contribute to nutritional security?",
  "A8: Millets are nutrient-dense, exhibit nutraceutical properties, and are good sources of dietary fiber and micronutrients, making them an important component of a balanced diet."
  
  "Q9: What is the energy value of millets?",
  "A9: The energy value of millets varies from approximately 307–347 Kcal."
  
  "Q10: How are millets utilized in different countries?",
  "A10: Millets are used as a staple food and source of nutrition in resource-constrained farming systems in arid and semi-arid regions, and as bird feed in several countries, including the United States."

  "Q1": "What are the challenges associated with scientific equipment in Research and Development Institutions and Universities?",
  "A1": "They require elaborate sample preparation methods, expensive standards for calibration and comparison, and highly trained manpower for operation and maintenance."
  
  "Q2": "Why is it necessary to maintain state-of-the-art scientific equipment facilities?",
  "A2": "To ensure high quality and competitive research in the current world scenario."
  
  "Q3": "What is the importance of accurate and precise measurement in scientific research?",
  "A3": "It is a basic requirement for the trueness and veracity of scientific findings."
  
  "Q4": "How does the advancement of science depend on access to advanced research instruments?",
  "A4": "Progress in science and understanding of complex scientific phenomena greatly depend on easy access to technically advanced quality research instruments."
  
  "Q5": "What is the financial impact of hi-tech scientific equipment on agricultural and biological research?",
  "A5": "Costs of research have increased significantly due to the requirement of advanced scientific equipment for accurate measurement purposes."
  
  "Q6": "What is the purpose of the Scientific Equipment Policy?",
  "A6": "To encourage effective use and sharing of scientific equipment, reduce financial burden on the government, and promote collaboration among researchers."
  
  "Q7": "How does the Scientific Equipment Policy aim to reduce redundant purchases of equipment?",
  "A7": "By promoting intra- and inter-Institutional, inter-departmental, and pan-India sharing of research facilities."
  
  "Q8": "What is the role of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) in the Scientific Equipment Policy?",
  "A8": "ICAR is committed to ensuring effective and convenient sharing of expensive research facilities among scientists of the same institute or other ICAR institutes."
  
  "Q9": "How does the Scientific Equipment Policy aim to increase the usage of facilities?",
  "A9": "By exploring the dynamics of research infrastructure funding and removing barriers that currently stall the effective sharing of facilities."
  
  "Q10": "What is the significance of the Nanaji Deshmukh Plant Phenomics Center in the context of the Scientific Equipment Policy?",
  "A10": "The Nanaji Deshmukh Plant Phenomics Center serves as an example of the need to remove barriers that hinder the effective sharing of expensive research facilities."

{
  "Q1": "What is the purpose of sharing scientific equipment?",
  "A1": "Sharing scientific equipment reduces government expenditure, avoids redundant purchases, and ensures effective use of resources."

  "Q2": "When are multiple purchases of scientific equipment permitted?",
  "A2": "Multiple purchases are permitted when the equipment is used for a large number of samples, ensuring time and cost effectiveness, and avoiding undue waiting periods."

  "Q3": "What factors should be considered in purchasing and operating scientific equipment?",
  "A3": "The number of samples tested, hours of operation, and costs of purchase, maintenance, and operation should be considered."

  "Q4: "How does sharing scientific equipment benefit researchers?",
  "A4": "Sharing equipment encourages collaborations, maximizes equipment usage, and enhances the benefit-cost ratio."

  "Q1": "What is the purpose of NARES in the Indian agricultural sector?",
  "A1": "NARES aims to harness advances in science for the welfare of society and engage fully with farmers, industry, entrepreneurs, and consumers.",
  "Q2": "How is information and communication technology (ICT) being used in Indian agricultural research?",
  "A2": "ICT is being used to transform the ecosystem of agriculture research, education, and extension through various digital programs and initiatives.",
  "Q3": "What is the Digital India Mission?",
  "A3": "The Digital India Mission is a government initiative to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.",
  "Q4": "What is the role of ICAR in the evolution of agricultural research in India?",
  "A4": "ICAR has launched several agricultural research and digital programs to transform and enable digitally empowered services in the agricultural sector.",
  "Q5": "What is the ICT-Roadmap and its eight pillars of good governance?",
  "A5": "The ICT-Roadmap is a policy initiative by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (Meity) that focuses on open source software, open APIs, e-mail policy, use of IT resources, collaborative application development, and application development for cloud-ready applications.",
  "Q6": "What are the three main aims of the e-Governance policies?",
  "A6": "The three main aims are easy governance, effective governance, and good governance.",
  "Q7": "What is the purpose of the "Policy on adoption of open source software for Government of India"?",
  "A7": "The policy encourages the formal adoption and use of Open Source Software (OSS) in government organizations to ensure strategic control of e-Governance assets and business continuity.",
  "Q8": "What is the "Framework for Adoption of Open Source Software in e-Governance Systems"?",
  "A8": "The framework provides recommendations and procedures for promoting, managing, and enhancing the adoption of OSS in e-Governance systems.",
  "Q9": "How do the e-Governance policies benefit government organizations?",
  "A9": "The policies provide key principles for revamping existing projects and guide new and ongoing e-Governance projects, ensuring efficient, transparent, and affordable services to citizens.",
  "Q10": "What is the role of subject matter experts in the development of e-Governance policies?",
  "A10": "Subject matter experts from government departments, industry, and academia contribute their knowledge and expertise to ensure the policies are based on national and international best practices."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the significance of millets in addressing nutrient deficiencies?",
  "A1": "Millets have a balanced nutritional composition, rich in micronutrients like iron, zinc, and calcium, making them relevant in addressing nutrient deficiencies."
  
  "Q2": "Why are millets considered 'smart food'?",
  "A2": "Millets are considered 'smart food' due to their low carbon footprint, adaptability to climate extremes, and nutritional benefits."
  
  "Q3: What is the 'International Year of Millets'?",
  "A3": "The 'International Year of Millets' is an initiative by the United Nations, declared in 2023, to create awareness about the nutritive value, health benefits, and cultivation of millets."
  
  "Q4: What is the purpose of the textbook on sugarcane cultivation practices in India?",
  "A4": "The textbook aims to provide comprehensive information on sugarcane cultivation practices in 17 Indian states, serving as a knowledge resource for research, training, extension, and development activities."
  
  "Q5: Who are the intended readers of the sugarcane cultivation textbook?",
  "A5": "The textbook is intended for stakeholders, researchers, and interested readers who want to learn about sugarcane cultivation practices across different Indian states."
  
  "Q6: What are some key topics covered in the sugarcane cultivation textbook?",
  "A6": "The textbook covers topics such as climatic conditions, soil, cropping systems, tillage, planting methods, fertilizers, irrigation, weed management, and cultivation economics."
  
  "Q7: How does the textbook address the lack of information on sugarcane management practices in India?",
  "A7": "The textbook collates and presents information on sugarcane management practices from different states, making it a comprehensive resource for the sugarcane industry."
  
  "Q8: What is the role of the ICAR-Indian Institute of Millets Research in promoting millets?",
  "A8": "The ICAR-Indian Institute of Millets Research is dedicated to research on millets, contributing to the development of sustainable nutritional security through millet cultivation."
  
  "Q9: What is the importance of the 'International Year of Millets' for India?",
  "A9": "The 'International Year of Millets' is significant for India as it was proposed by India to the FAO, highlighting the country's commitment to promoting millets and sustainable agriculture."
  
  "Q10: How can one obtain a copy of the sugarcane cultivation textbook?",
  "A10": "Copies of the textbook can be obtained by contacting the Business Unit Directorate of Knowledge Management in Agriculture at Krishi Anusandhan Bhavan-I, Pusa, New Delhi."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the main objective of the Software Development group (FG2)?",
  "A1": "The main objective of the Software Development group is to collect requirements for software development and ensure that the development follows Government of India and software engineering guidelines, principles, and standards."
  
  "Q2": "What is the role of the UI / UX Design group (SG1)?",
  "A2": "The UI / UX Design group is responsible for designing responsive web interfaces, layouts, screens, logos, images, and headers."
  
  "Q3: What does the Application Development group (SG2) do?",
  "A3: "The Application Development group designs and develops standalone and web-based software, manages and monitors the source code repository, and maintains interoperability across various applications."
  
  "Q4: What is the responsibility of the Web Portal Development group (SG3)?",
  "A4: "The Web Portal Development group is responsible for developing web portals and ensuring technology-specific and cross-platform development."
  
  "Q5: What is the role of the Mobile App Development group (SG4)?",
  "A5: "The Mobile App Development group develops and upgrades mobile applications."
  
  "Q6: What does the API and Web Service Development group (SG5) do?",
  "A6: "The API and Web Service Development group ensures compliance with standards and interoperability, and develops APIs and web services."
  
  "Q7: What is the role of the Software Standards and Quality Assurance group (FG3)?",
  "A7: "The Software Standards and Quality Assurance group is responsible for preparing, generating, and maintaining software standards and quality assurance."
  
  "Q8: How does the Software Development group ensure interoperability?",
  "A8: "The Software Development group ensures interoperability by adhering to Government of India and software engineering guidelines, principles, and standards, as well as developing APIs and web services."
  
  "Q9: What is the purpose of the Software Requirement Specification (SRS) document?",
  "A9: "The Software Requirement Specification (SRS) document helps in the development of application software, portals, mobile apps, APIs, and web services, and ensures that the development follows the necessary guidelines and standards."
  
  "Q10: What is the role of the ICT Steering Committee in software development?",
  "A10: "The ICT Steering Committee approves the requirements for software development and oversees the overall planning objectives and key performance indicators."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the role of the Monitoring body in the Council?",
  "A1": "The Monitoring body monitors different ICT programs/initiatives and emerging/disruptive IT technologies at the national level."
  
  "Q2": "What is the purpose of providing guidelines and directives for collaboration with institutions and organizations?",
  "A2": "The purpose is to foster collaboration with national and international institutions/organizations working in the field of ICT and disruptive technologies."
  
  "Q3": "What is the responsibility of the Implementation and Operational Management Committee (IOMC)?",
  "A3": "The IOMC is responsible for implementing ICT initiatives, managing operations, and supporting IT operations to achieve ICAR's vision, mission, and strategic goals."
  
  "Q4": "Who are the members of the IOMC?",
  "A4": "The IOMC consists of leaders from all functional groups, representatives from other related government departments or ministries, the Director (Finance), the Director (Administration), the Head (Computer Application) at ICAR-IASRI, and invited members as per requirement."
  
  "Q5": "What is the role of the IOMC in change management?",
  "A5": "The IOMC formulates and assigns a change management plan whenever necessary, and devises a plan to sensitize, educate, and train users for adaptability of a system within ICAR."
  
  "Q6": "How often does the Implementation and Operational Management Committee meet?",
  "A6": "The committee meets normally twice a year, but can be called anytime as per requirement."
  
  "Q7: What is the role of the Monitoring body in resource allocation?",
  "A7: The Monitoring body identifies and ensures resources required for implementing national level programs in the field of emerging/disruptive technologies in IT."
  
  "Q8: What is the role of the Monitoring body in capacity building?",
  "A8: The Monitoring body identifies and approves relevant areas for capacity building in the field of IT/ICT in the Council."
  
  "Q9: What is the role of the Monitoring body in assigning roles and functions to ICAR institutes?",
  "A9: The Monitoring body assigns roles and functions to different ICAR institutes to work in a national program of importance in the field of ICT and disruptive technologies."
  
  "Q10: What is the role of the Monitoring body in project initiation and monitoring?",
  "A10: The Monitoring body initiates new programs/projects or discontinues current programs/projects as per directives of the Standing Committee."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the purpose of the committee mentioned in the text?",
  "A1": "The committee is responsible for ensuring overall sustainability, maintenance, and upgradation of ICT infrastructure and framework, as well as organizational continuity."
  
  "Q2": "How often will the committee meet to assess the health of IT initiatives?",
  "A2": "The committee will meet regularly, on a monthly basis, to assess the health of IT initiatives and provide relevant guidance."
  
  "Q3": "What role will the committee play in case of a fallback or disaster?",
  "A3": "The committee will invoke necessary guidelines, procedures, directions, and measures to ensure organizational continuity in case of a fallback or disaster."
  
  "Q4": "What is the role of the ICT Unit at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi?",
  "A4": "The ICT Unit at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi will help in implementation, coordination, and monitoring of IT services to the Council and its institutes."
  
  "Q5": "Who will be responsible for managing and maintaining the ICT and Non-ICT infrastructural facilities at ICAR-IASRI and ICAR-NAARM?",
  "A5": "The facilities will be managed and maintained by outsourcing under the supervision of a Principal / Senior Scientist who will lead the Infrastructural Functional Group."
  
  "Q6: What is the role of the Functional Groups in the ICT Unit?",
  "A6: The Functional Groups will be created in the ICT Unit and will work under the supervision of the Group Leader of the respective Functional Group."
  
  "Q7: How will the Group Leaders of the Functional Groups be reviewed?",
  "A7: The Group Leaders will be reviewed by ADG (ICT), ICAR."
  
  "Q8: What is the role of the ICT Roadmap in the implementation plan of ICT activities?",
  "A8: The ICT Roadmap will provide a phased implementation plan for ICT activities in ICAR."
  
  "Q9: What is the role of the ICT Unit in the EFC?",
  "A9: The ICT Unit will have a separate budget allocation through EFC for implementation, coordination, and monitoring of IT services."
  
  "Q10: What is the role of ICAR-IASRI and ICAR-NAARM in assisting the ICT Unit?",
  "A10: ICAR-IASRI and ICAR-NAARM will assist the ICT Unit by generating resources and providing support for the implementation and maintenance of ICT infrastructure."
}

{
  "Q1": "What is the purpose of the ICT Unit of the Council?",
  "A1": "The ICT Unit is responsible for the development, implementation, capacity building, management, and monitoring of IT/ICT activities in different ICAR institutes."
  
  "Q2": "How does the ICT Unit provide support to ICAR institutes?",
  "A2": "The ICT Unit provides support through contractual manpower and also by identifying and approving IT-based short duration projects for funding."
  
  "Q3": "What is the role of Group Leaders in the ICT Unit?",
  "A3": "Group Leaders are given limited financial and administrative power to ensure smooth functioning of services, especially emergency services."
  
  "Q4": "What is the role of the Steering Committee in the ICT Unit?",
  "A4": "The Steering Committee identifies and approves IT-based short duration projects for funding to different ICAR institutes."
  
  "Q5": "What is the purpose of the centralized 24x7 Helpdesk service center?",
  "A5": "The Helpdesk service center provides all ICT services and works under Functional Group – 4 i.e., Implementation, Operational, Maintenance, and Support."
  
  "Q6: What is the ICT-Roadmap?",
  "A6: The ICT-Roadmap outlines the tentative targets and milestones of the proposed ICT unit in Phase-I, Phase-II, and Phase-III."
  
  "Q7: What are some of the targets/milestones for Phase I of the ICT-Roadmap?",
  "A7: Some targets/milestones for Phase I include the development of data standards and ICT policies, standardization of ICAR institutes' websites and digital systems, and implementation of e-office in ICAR."
  
  "Q8: What is the role of the IT Unit created at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi?",
  "A8: The IT Unit at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi, leads different proposed Functional Groups and is supported by technical staff."
  
  "Q9: What kind of manpower does the ICT Unit require?",
  "A9: The ICT Unit requires minimal permanent scientific, technical, administrative, financial, and supporting manpower, and mainly contractual staff with different levels of expertise and experience."
  
  "Q10: What are some of the responsibilities of the ICT Unit in terms of digital agriculture?",
  "A10: The ICT Unit is responsible for coordinating digital agricultural platforms, precision agriculture, and developing and integrating digital information networks for farmers."
}

{
  "Q1": "What are the challenges in the field of IT/ICT regarding staffing?",
  "A1": "The rapid and diversified technological changes in IT/ICT make it difficult to recruit permanent staff in each field, necessitating the hiring of contractual staff with different expertise as required."
  
  "Q2": "How does hiring contractual staff benefit the Council in the field of IT/ICT?",
  "A2": "Hiring contractual staff with different expertise allows the Council to develop digital solutions using the latest technologies, while also providing flexibility and efficiency in developing various digital solutions."
  
  "Q3": "What is the role of permanent staff in the ICT Unit of ICAR?",
  "A3": "Permanent staff in the ICT Unit of ICAR are re-deployed from existing cadres of the Council, and they are responsible for various roles such as scientists, technical staff, under secretaries, FAO, section officers, and assistant/UDC/LDC."
  
  "Q4": "How many permanent staff are required in the ICT Unit at ICAR, New Delhi?",
  "A4": "The ICT Unit at ICAR, New Delhi requires a total of 27 permanent staff, including 3 scientists, 3 technical staff, 1 under secretary, 1 FAO, 1 section officer, and 5 assistant/UDC/LDC."
  
  "Q5": "How many permanent staff are required in the IT Unit at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi?",
  "A5": "The IT Unit at ICAR-IASRI, New Delhi requires a total of 11 permanent staff, including 5 scientists, 5 technical staff, and 1 assistant/UDC/LDC."
  
  "Q6": "Why is capacity building important for permanent staff in the field of IT/ICT?",
  "A6": "Capacity building is essential to make permanent staff productive, effective, and competitive in the latest ICT/IT developments."
  
  "Q7": "How many contractual manpower are required in the field of IT/ICT at present?",
  "A7": "At present, a maximum of 50 contractual manpower of various categories may be required in the field of IT/ICT."
  
  "Q8": "What are the qualifications and experience of contractual staff in the field of IT/ICT?",
  "A8": "The qualifications and experience of contractual staff in the field of IT/ICT may be modified based on requirements from time to time."
  
  "Q9": "How is the hiring of contractual staff in the field of IT/ICT done?",
  "A9": "The hiring of contractual staff in the field of IT/ICT is done following ICAR/DST/GoI procedures and approval from the Competent Authority."
  
  "Q10": "What is the purpose of the 'Ex-situ Crop Residue Management Options' publication?",
  "A10": "The 'Ex-situ Crop Residue Management Options' publication provides information and guidance on managing crop residues outside the field to reduce the problem of crop residue burning."
}
